metadata.synopsis: Caribbean pirates (Robert Shaw, James Earl Jones) assist a noble damsel and foil a quirky tyrant (Peter Boyle).

reviews: Be on guard for Swashbuckler, one of the grandest sea adventures ever filmed.
Several fine performers are perversely miscast in this movie.
The resulting film is a self-conscious attempt that survives only through the good will of the audience.
People who go to this film will know exactly what to expect, and they are not going to be disappointed.
Swashbuckler is an attempt to spoof the pirate movies of the 1930s and 1940s -- an Errol Flynn picture without Errol Flynn, and a funny that's not a funny.
... just a dumb film boasting broadly bad performances by a good cast, some pleasant scenery, the pleasure of watching a real ship tossing on a real ocean ...
It's been a long time since Hollywood gave us a decent pirate movie, and that by itself is one reason for liking Swashbuckler.
